sect2.title: Installation of MPlayer
sect2.para: The extra downloads should be located in your source directory with the bzip2 files decompressed.

note.para: The package maintainers recommend building without any optimization

sect2.para: Install MPlayer by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: install -d /usr/lib/win32 && tar -xvf ../win32codecs.tar -C /usr/lib/win32 && tar -xvf ../qt5dlls.tar -C /usr/lib/win32 && tar -xvf ../qt6dlls.tar -C /usr/lib/win32 && tar -xvf ../qtextras.tar -C /usr/lib/win32 && tar -xvf ../rp9codecs.tar -C /usr/lib/win32 && ./configure --prefix=/usr --confdir=/etc/mplayer --enable-largefiles \ --enable-gui --enable-menu --enable-new-conf --enable-qtx-codecs \ --enable-vorbis --with-reallibdir=/usr/lib/win32/rp9codecs \ --enable-freetype --enable-shared-pp && make && make install

sect3.title: Installing the prerendered Fonts
sect3.para: If freetype is in use, the only advantage of prerendered fonts is that they are faster. Install them like this:

screen.userinput: install -d /usr/share/mplayer/font && tar -xvf ../font-arial-iso-8859-1.tar -C /usr/share/mplayer/font && for i in /usr/share/mplayer/font/font-arial-<size>* do ln -s $i /usr/share/mplayer/font; done

sect3.para: If you have SCSI-Emulation activated for the drives, you'll need to get the right SCSI-device. Every CD/DVD-ROM drive is mapped in the same order as in IDE to the devices named /dev/scd0, /dev/scd1 and so on.
